abstract: Editorial notes important epidemiological questions raised by scientists reconstructing the genetic code of the Black Death plague, which killed 25 million people in the 1300s.
snippet: The genetic code of the Black Death, which killed 25 million in the 1300s, has been reconstructed and raises two basic questions.
lead_paragraph: The genetic code of the Black Death, which killed 25 million in the 1300s, has been reconstructed and raises two basic questions.

headline.main: Why Has the Black Death Paled?
headline.print_headline: Why Has the Black Death Paled?
headline.seo: Why Has the Black Death Paled?
